data.title: A Very Cozy Pizza Restaurant
data.text:
I use the term "pizza restaurant" because it is fine dining and not a "joint."
This was out first visit to Falora.  Have always wanted to go here, but it opens at 4 PM and we generally leave Tucson to go home before the traffic starts.  This night was a stayover for a next day medical procedure so we hopped on the chance.
Ample parking, not too busy and over the top friendly wait staff!
The first impression was "this place is CLEAN!"  We sat at the small bar where we could watch our dinners created.
We each had a salad, my Wife a Caprese and I a Butter Pecan.
One of these salads could've been a meal; MASSIVE!  We watched it being masterfully prepared.  No bagged commercial stuff here, all fresh and tastefully accented with dressing.  Our pizza order wasn't put in the oven until we were nearly completed with the salad which gave enough time to clear our plates.  
The Cura pizza was a circular masterpiece!  San Marzano tomato sauce base, soppresata, olives, whole garlic toes and cheese, artfully arranged and cooked to a T.  The crust was light and puffy and stood up well to the toppings.  Without the salads, I think we could've had our own pies, but the one satisfied our appetites perfectly.
For desert, we were drawn to the Panna Cotta.  Black raspberry panna cotta to be exact, served in a very nouveau and rustic way: in a jelly jar!  The panna acotta was pre-filled with the panna cotta and the raspberry preserves "dolloped" on top.  After staring at it for a few minutes we were instructed on how to eat it.  You fold it together, bringing the fruit down and the panna cotta up.  Delicioso!
Ari, the owner, is a very personable and friendly guy.  He had a smile on his face the entire time we we there and engaged in friendly conversation..  Nothing pretentious, just down to earth and very proud and passionate about his craft.
Now we have to think of another excuse to stay over in Tucson so we can go back to Falora!!!

data.title: Pizza just ok, but took much longer than expected
data.text:
Summary based on one dinner:
--average artisan pizza, not sure the ingredients came together on the one we tried
--ok service, but for some reason our uncomplicated order took forever. We saw several tables that came in later get their food before us. At the end we got a bill for another table.
--seated immediately on a walk-in on a Thursday around 6:30PM
--easy parking in lot in rear

Based on the other ratings, I may have just had the occasional not-so-great experience. They happen.

data.title: Very nice ambience, fresh ingredients, good service
data.text: Falora's pizzas are not large, but the thin crust is very good and the toppings are fresh.  The tomato sauce is oddly sour but very tomatoey. The salads are very large and the kale salad was unusual and satisfying.  They only have a few bottled beers, nothing on tap.  The wines are ok but are served in tumblers rather than stemware which always detracts from our enjoyment of the wine.  The server was enthusiastic and helpful. We had one white pizza and one red, each had 6 small slices.  We brought home 3 slices.  One pizza is not enough to share for dinner.   The prices are high.  We were surprised the bill was over $75.  We liked the vibe, sort of neo-mid-century modern.  However, we have had better pizza at a better value elsewhere in Tucson.

data.title: Delightful dinner on the patio on a Monday evening
data.text: We live in the neighborhood and walked over with our dog.  We sat on the patio and enjoyed leisurely service and the salad we shared along with the Margherita pizza.  Our server was attentive to both us and our canine companion who was served a bowl of water and later a doggy treat.  The human meal was very good - all made with fresh vegetables and had delicious flavor.  This is not a "routine" pizza restaurant.  The menu including the pizza and salad offerings changes as different produce is in season and available.  We highly recommend that you give Falora a try.

data.title: Delicious pizza and salad
data.text: We had dinner at Falora to try the pizza. It turned out to be delicious but we enjoyed the salad even more. It was so good. I look forward to eating there again.

data.title: The grooviest place in Tucson for Pizza, salad and a friendly atmosphere
data.text: My family went to Falora for a Sunday dinner.  We sat at the counter and watched the kitchen magic take place all the while talking with the owner Ari.  One of the coolest parts of Falora is that you have an opportunity to pick out albums to play on their stereo and talk rock-n-rock with Ari.  You get to create your own pizza and your soundtrack.  If anyone is yearning for a great piece of pie with an amazing atmosphere Falora is your place!

data.title: High Quality Ingredients, Warm Welcome, Good Service, and Heavenly Pizza
data.text:
My wife and I have been here three times since Fall 2015, the latest with another couple in January 2016. We have a favorite pizza, Margherita, that they make exceptionally well.  We've tried the Fumo (smoked salmon and chevre) which is also very good.
Italian 00 flour, San Marzano tomatoes, and the pecan wood fired imported pizza oven make for a fantastic Napoli pie.  If you prefer Chicago-style (thick crust), or worse yet, Pizza Hut, you're confused and need therapy. Perhaps some time at Falora can guide you back to sanity.
The owner, Ari, is also the pizza chef, and regularly makes the rounds to make sure the customers are satisfied.
The décor is simple, and the large table in the center of the restaurant is setup for group dining (play nice with your neighbors).  There are additional smaller tables available as well, but it's smart to call for reservations. If you want a show with your meal, get a seat at the counter where you can watch the pies being made and can see the oven in action.
They serve alcohol, and while the list isn't extensive (or expensive), it pairs with the food well and should make most people happy.

data.title: Warm, welcoming and unusual restaurant!
data.text:
This is one of my neighborhood restaurants. I love it and they never fail to satisfy! Went to Falora with a new friend with the idea of having one of their amazing special salads, that I have talked about in another review. The special Sleeping Frog Farm salad selection was, alas, not available. Instead we opted for a pizza, although I prefer no carbs. 
We chose to share a Figaro with brie, brussel sprouts, walnuts, figs, olive oil, balsamic. It was amazing! I skipped the outside of the crust, but the pie itself was beyond reproach and gave us sweet, savory, and sexy all in one.
To drink, we had the Aperol Splitzer for two. Wonderful and a new discovery for us both.
The service was timely, discreet. and personal. At the end of our meal, Ari came to our table for a brief chat as he often does. All in all, the meal was wonderful in all respects. I love this place!

data.title: Hi-Light at Falora was around the corner---SIDECAR BAR!
data.text:
We are not as fond of the Napoli style pizza, considering the great pie places available in Tucson----however, did enjoy the thin crust flavour.
Overall service and atmosphere were Ok, but OH HUM!
Than someone recommended the Sidecar Bar around the back of the building
for some craft cocktails-----and specialty drinks----that made for a much more
interesting evening!
Outdoor patio---informative beverage service---innovative cocktail menu----and
NO FOOD! You were referred back to the Falora Pizza place.
This Craft Bar was fun, and the featured cocktails were well though-out,
and refreshing! Wines and beers also available.
Our favourites were the Lemoncello, and dark and stormy.
Bravo Sidecar!
Rcommended.

data.title: Genuine Italian Trattoria
data.text: An intimate setting, personal service, authentic Napoli style pizza with inventive salads and quality libations add up to a wonderfully comfortable dining experience. The staff is helpful, prices reasonable and food exquisitely prepared. Yet Falora feels like a welcoming neighborhood bistro and not pretentious in the least. It's going to become a family go-to eatery for me.

data.title: Delicious Authentic Italian Food
data.text: We have been visiting Falora since they opened and have enjoyed the food every time - the pizza is perfectly prepared, the crust is crispy and chewy at the same time and toppings are creative, fresh, and well varied.  It's a little overpriced ($13 and up for a very small pie).   The salads are fresh, and the bread (worth the highway robbery $5 price) is unforgettable.  Unfortunately, the parking (terminally slow valet on weekends and you have no choice but to use it Thurs-Sunday) is annoying for Tucson.  The service is warm and friendly - but disorganized and unapologetic when things go wrong.

data.title: Pizza with a Side of Vinyl.
data.text: Falora is a popular neighborhood pizza cafe - offering wood fired pizza with a thin crispy crust pizza, salads, beer and wine. It is a small cafe with some outdoor seating. They are branching out since opening and offering more greens and desserts. The Margherita and Bianca are our favorite pies. If you are hungry, you may want to order two - a bit on the pricey side for what you get, but very flavorful and high quality ingredients. They are a little stingy on the toppings - but then they are also generous in that they give back to local charities - so, all in all - worth trying. And they play vintage vinyl records - how cool is that?

data.title: Very surprised
data.text: This place was a great Friday nite out for us. The staff really looked after us when the rain started to come down on the deck. Had a nice bottle of  chardonnay with the caprese. The wood fired pizza was excellent. Will be back again soon.

data.title: It's Nice in Every Way
data.text: I came here right after it opened, and I have enjoyed every meal since. I love, love, love the kale salad, though it should be macerated as it can be a little tough. Perhaps tearing the kale into smaller pieces would help but man, that dressing and the combination of ingredients is pure magic. The Caprese is gorgeous and tasty, too. Another reviewer complained that the way their pizza was served was not how they had it in Italy. Well, I have spent a considerable amount of in Italy too, and all I can say is that Falora's pizza is very, very good. The servers are darling, attentive and knowledgeable. Love that pizza oven!

data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: My husband and I went here for our two year dating anniversary. We love love loved the pizza but the Cesar salad was far too salty! We had a hard time eating it...and we left more than half because we just couldn't eat it. Again, pizza was fantastic & the atmosphere was cozy and welcoming. We had such a lovely time :)

data.title: Incredible wood-fired pizza with great service!
data.text: First off, I'll just say that as Phoenicians, we've of course been to Pizzeria Bianco. As foodies, we'd heard about Falora's comparison to PB, so on a recent trip to Tucson we had to dine at Falora. Our dinner at Falora was awesome, & we'll definitely return! After dining at both Falora & PB, we came to the conclusion that it's difficult to compare the 2 because each are unique. Crusts at both places are wood-fired, but the premium toppings make them unique. Service was great. We arrived for an early dinner, so we didn't have to wait for a table (both indoor & outdoor patio seating available). The menu includes a list of around 10-12 pizzas, a few salads, & appetizers. We were starving, so we each ordered (& finished off) our own pizza. If you're not as hungry, you could easily share a pizza & also a salad/appetizer. I couldn't decide between the Pesto or Fumo (smoked salmon) pizzas, so I ordered the Pesto pizza & had the chef add smoked salmon...AMAZING!! My husband was very pleased with his Cura (salami) pizza. Our pizzas were done in prob less than 10 minutes! We paired our pizzas with wine & beer. The only suggestion I could give to the restaurant is to add maybe a bit more variety to the wine/beer list. Otherwise, everything was great, & we can't wait to return on a future trip to Tucson!

data.title: Great surprise!
data.text: Our last night in Tucson on a college visit trip, we lucked in to finding Falora. What a treat! Superb pizza with premium ingredients (those two words don't do them justice), cooked to perfection, huge salads, nice wine . . . and the service was delightful. I'm not a communal table kind of person after schlepping all over looking at the campus, so having some privacy at dinner was important to me. Luckily, we were there early enough to get a small table. Now we know the best 4-top can be reserved . . . I hope our son chooses U of A so we can return often. And bring vinyl for the place's turntable. And bring my bike to ride there.

data.title: Best Pizza in Tucson
data.text: Pizza in the spirit of Pizza Bianco but better.  The smoked salmon was a favorite but I don't think you can go wrong here.  Reasonable price, nice atmosphere, convenient location, and great service.

data.title: good pizza
data.text: I got the pesto pizza to go. Ready within 15minutes. A little without mariana sauce. But good and homemade. $16 for pizza - reasonable.

data.title: Molto buono!
data.text: Our first time to Falora. Great atmosphere, nice folks and yummy, floury crust pizzas. The salmon and goat cheese pizza was fab, I had them add fresh arugula after cooking...super! We lived in Napoli twice, this was a nice munch down memory lane. Be sure to bring your favorite LP at 1630, they will play it on their turntable and give you a free bottle of wine for bringing it!
